dc:title: On Pilgrimage - April 1963
dc:author: Dorothy Day
dc:description: Complains about a litter-filled city park, wondering why the unemployed aren't put to work to beautify it. Receives a gift of Spanish language lessons and enjoys a visit to her daughter's family in Vermont. Eulogizes Joe Roach, a long-time resident at their farm--"Joe was another Lazarus."
